snippet: Daniel Doctoroff, a former deputy mayor who was a driving force behind the city’s Olympic proposal, said a host of big construction projects were spurred forward by the effort.
abstract: Former Deputy Mayor Daniel L Doctoroff says New York City's proposal to host the 2012 Olympic Games, while unsuccessful, spurred a host of big construction efforts and brought other benefits to the city; Doctoroff was the driving force behind the sweeping proposal to turn New York into a sports mecca and reshape the waterfront.
lead_paragraph: Daniel Doctoroff, a former deputy mayor who was a driving force behind the city’s Olympic proposal, said a host of big construction projects were spurred forward by the effort.

headline.seo: New York’s Olympic Bid Failed, but Helped the City, Doctoroff Says
headline.main: Olympic Bid, Though Unsuccessful, Helped the City, Its Champion Says
headline.print_headline: Olympic Bid, Though Unsuccessful, Brought Benefits to the City, Its Champion Says
